1.text: Admonish them to be subject to princes and powers, to obey at a word, to be ready to every good work.

2.text: To speak evil of no man, not to be litigious, but gentle: shewing all mildness towards all men.

3.text: For we ourselves also were some time unwise, incredulous, erring, slaves to divers desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

4.text: But when the goodness and kindness of God our Savior appeared:

5.text: Not by the works of justice, which we have done, but according to his mercy, he saved us, by the laver of regeneration, and renovation of the Holy Ghost;

6.text: Whom he hath poured forth upon us abundantly, through Jesus Christ our Savior:

7.text: That, being justified by his grace, we may be heirs, according to hope of life everlasting.

8.text: It is a faithful saying: and these things I will have thee affirm constantly: that they, who believe in God, may be careful to excel in good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

9.text: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law. For they are unprofitable and vain.

10.text: A man that is a heretic, after the first and second admonition, avoid:

11.text: Knowing that he, that is such an one, is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned by his own judgment.

12.text: When I shall send to thee Artemas or Tychicus, make haste to come unto me to Nicopolis. For there I have determined to winter.

13.text: Send forward Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollo, with care, that nothing be wanting to them.

14.text: And let our men also learn to excel in good works for necessary uses: that they be not unfruitful.

15.text: All that are with me salute thee: salute them that love us in the faith. The grace of God be with you all. Amen.
